results.title: For you madam. [No. 66/14] = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. French novelist Edmonde Charles-Rout at home and strolling through Paris. 2. How to make a pleated cross-cut skirt. 3. Maurice Bejant’s ballet production of Romeo and Juliet featuring the music of Berlioz.

results.title: For you madam. [67/10] = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Caussade, the French hat making capital; Shoes and gloves for Winter ‘67 at the 25th International Leather Show; Winter sports clothing; Artist Francoise Adnet shows her paintings. Full transcription inside film can.

results.title: For you madam = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Connaissance de la France - celebrates France’s 8th century first gothic building, Sants Cathedral, consecrated by Pope Alexander III in 1164. 2. In 1940, France’s National Geographical Institute set out to make a new map of the country, scheduled for completion in 1980. This segment focuses on the project’s progress. 3. Looks at an exhibition of masterpieces hosted by a French regional gallery which will eventually reach the Louvre. 4. ‘Foire de Paris = Paris Fair’ - presents some of the highlights. 5. Visits a bull-ring in Southern France which although controversial, attracts thousands of spectators. Shows the different stages of a bull-fight.

results.title: For the love of a horse
results.brief_description: Follows the training and competition events of a 13 year-old girl and her horse as they prepare for equestrian trials. The girl’s trainer is Jim Elder, Canada’s Olympic gold medal winner, who explains the correct and incorrect procedures for equestrian riding. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Kokoda front line!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly news magazine (No. 568) produced by Cinesound in Sydney. This edition consists of one ‘fullreel’ item - “Kokoda Front Line” - by Damien Parer about the war in New Guinea. Includes a discussion on jungle warfare and the servicing of Australian troops on the front line. Winner of an Academy Award in 1942. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The AIF's Great Route March : Review No 460
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
This Cinesound newsreel consists of footage of the AIF’s Great Route March - a training march across the Blue Mountains to Bathurst which took twelve days over one hundred and thirty miles.

results.title: Drought grips Riverina
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel (Ep. 679) consisting of one “full-reel” item: “Drought grips Riverina”, alerting the public to the severity of the drought, and criticising the destructive abuse of the land by farmers who overstock. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: R.A.N. ashore and afloat: it's the navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
Special 1000th issue of Cinesound Review devoted to the Royal Australian Navy; the Senior Service. Class room training and recruitment is put to good use aboard the H.M.A.S. Latrobe. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Moresby under the blitz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel. This issue is a film by Damien Parer of the war in New Guinea, including his dramatic footage of the bombing of the Macdhul.
